recordName.description: The domain name for this record.

ttl.description: The resource record cache time to live (TTL).

nameServers.description: The name servers to report in the delegation records.

targetDomain.description:
The redirect target fully qualified domain name (FQDN).

An alias record
will be created that points to your CloudFront distribution. Root domain
or sub-domain can be supplied.

zone.description:
Hosted zone of the domain which will be used to create alias record(s) from domain names in the hosted zone to the target domain.

The hosted zone must
contain entries for the domain name(s) supplied through `recordNames` that
will redirect to the target domain.

Domain names in the hosted zone can include a specific domain (example.com)
and its subdomains (acme.example.com, zenith.example.com).

certificate.description:
The AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) certificate that will be associated with the CloudFront distribution that will be created.

If provided, the certificate must be
stored in us-east-1 (N. Virginia)

recordNames.description: The domain names that will redirect to `targetDomain`.

allowedMethods.description: An HTTP method that you allow the origin to execute.

allowedOrigins.description: One or more origins you want customers to be able to access the bucket from.

allowedHeaders.description: Headers that are specified in the Access-Control-Request-Headers header.

exposedHeaders.description: One or more headers in the response that you want customers to be able to access from their applications.

id.description: A unique identifier for this rule.

maxAge.description: The time in seconds that your browser is to cache the preflight response for the specified resource.

archiveAccessTierTime.description: When enabled, Intelligent-Tiering will automatically move objects that havent been accessed for a minimum of 90 days to the Archive Access tier.

deepArchiveAccessTierTime.description: When enabled, Intelligent-Tiering will automatically move objects that havent been accessed for a minimum of 180 days to the Deep Archive Access tier.

prefix.description: Add a filter to limit the scope of this configuration to a single prefix.

tags.description: You can limit the scope of this rule to the key value pairs added below.

bucket.description: Bucket where all inventories will be saved in.

bucketOwner.description:
The account ID that owns the destination S3 bucket.

If no account ID is provided, the owner is not validated before exporting data.
It's recommended to set an account ID to prevent problems if the destination bucket ownership changes.

prefix.description: The prefix to be used when saving the inventory.

enabled.description: Whether the inventory is enabled or disabled.

frequency.description: Frequency at which the inventory should be generated.

includeObjectVersions.description: If the inventory should contain all the object versions or only the current one.

objectsPrefix.description: The inventory will only include objects that meet the prefix filter criteria.

optionalFields.description: A list of optional fields to be included in the inventory result.

storageClass.description: The storage class to which you want the object to transition.

transitionAfter.description: Indicates the number of days after creation when objects are transitioned to the specified storage class.

noncurrentVersionsToRetain.description:
Indicates the number of noncurrent version objects to be retained.

Can be up to 100 noncurrent versions retained.

storageClass.description: The storage class to which you want the object to transition.

transitionAfter.description: Indicates the number of days after creation when objects are transitioned to the specified storage class.

transitionDate.description:
Indicates when objects are transitioned to the specified storage class.

The date value must be in ISO 8601 format. The time is always midnight UTC.

abortIncompleteMultipartUploadAfter.description:
Specifies a lifecycle rule that aborts incomplete multipart uploads to an Amazon S3 bucket.

The AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload property type creates a lifecycle
rule that aborts incomplete multipart uploads to an Amazon S3 bucket.
When Amazon S3 aborts a multipart upload, it deletes all parts
associated with the multipart upload.

enabled.description: Whether this rule is enabled.

expiration.description:
Indicates the number of days after creation when objects are deleted from Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier.

If you specify an expiration and transition time, you must use the same
time unit for both properties (either in days or by date). The
expiration time must also be later than the transition time.

expirationDate.description:
Indicates when objects are deleted from Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier.

The date value must be in ISO 8601 format. The time is always midnight UTC.

If you specify an expiration and transition time, you must use the same
time unit for both properties (either in days or by date). The
expiration time must also be later than the transition time.

expiredObjectDeleteMarker.description:
Indicates whether Amazon S3 will remove a delete marker with no noncurrent versions.

If set to true, the delete marker will be expired.

id.description:
A unique identifier for this rule.

The value cannot be more than 255 characters.

noncurrentVersionExpiration.description:
Time between when a new version of the object is uploaded to the bucket and when old versions of the object expire.

For buckets with versioning enabled (or suspended), specifies the time,
in days, between when a new version of the object is uploaded to the
bucket and when old versions of the object expire. When object versions
expire, Amazon S3 permanently deletes them. If you specify a transition
and expiration time, the expiration time must be later than the
transition time.

noncurrentVersionsToRetain.description:
Indicates a maximum number of noncurrent versions to retain.

If there are this many more noncurrent versions,
Amazon S3 permanently deletes them.

noncurrentVersionTransitions.description:
One or more transition rules that specify when non-current objects transition to a specified storage class.

Only for for buckets with versioning enabled (or suspended).

If you specify a transition and expiration time, the expiration time
must be later than the transition time.

objectSizeGreaterThan.description: Specifies the minimum object size in bytes for this rule to apply to.

objectSizeLessThan.description: Specifies the maximum object size in bytes for this rule to apply to.

prefix.description: Object key prefix that identifies one or more objects to which this rule applies.

tagFilters.description: The TagFilter property type specifies tags to use to identify a subset of objects for an Amazon S3 bucket.

transitions.description:
One or more transition rules that specify when an object transitions to a specified storage class.

If you specify an expiration and transition time, you must use the same
time unit for both properties (either in days or by date). The
expiration time must also be later than the transition time.

id.description: The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.

prefix.description: The prefix that an object must have to be included in the metrics results.

tagFilters.description:
Specifies a list of tag filters to use as a metrics configuration filter.

The metrics configuration includes only objects that meet the filter's criteria.

hostName.description: Name of the host where requests are redirected.

protocol.description: Protocol to use when redirecting requests.

httpErrorCodeReturnedEquals.description:
The HTTP error code when the redirect is applied.

In the event of an error, if the error code equals this value, then the specified redirect is applied.

If both condition properties are specified, both must be true for the redirect to be applied.

keyPrefixEquals.description:
The object key name prefix when the redirect is applied.

If both condition properties are specified, both must be true for the redirect to be applied.

condition.description: Specifies a condition that must be met for the specified redirect to apply.

hostName.description: The host name to use in the redirect request.

httpRedirectCode.description: The HTTP redirect code to use on the response.

protocol.description: Protocol to use when redirecting requests.

replaceKey.description: Specifies the object key prefix to use in the redirect request.

accessControl.description: Specifies a canned ACL that grants predefined permissions to the bucket.

autoDeleteObjects.description:
Whether all objects should be automatically deleted when the bucket is removed from the stack or when the stack is deleted.

Requires the `removalPolicy` to be set to `RemovalPolicy.DESTROY`.

**Warning** if you have deployed a bucket with `autoDeleteObjects: true`,
switching this to `false` in a CDK version *before* `1.126.0` will lead to
all objects in the bucket being deleted. Be sure to update your bucket resources
by deploying with CDK version `1.126.0` or later **before** switching this value to `false`.

blockPublicAccess.description: The block public access configuration of this bucket.

bucketKeyEnabled.description:
Specifies whether Amazon S3 should use an S3 Bucket Key with server-side encryption using KMS (SSE-KMS) for new objects in the bucket.

Only relevant, when Encryption is set to {@link BucketEncryption.KMS}

cors.description: The CORS configuration of this bucket.

encryption.description:
The kind of server-side encryption to apply to this bucket.

If you choose KMS, you can specify a KMS key via `encryptionKey`. If
encryption key is not specified, a key will automatically be created.

encryptionKey.description:
External KMS key to use for bucket encryption.

The 'encryption' property must be either not specified or set to "Kms".
An error will be emitted if encryption is set to "Unencrypted" or
"Managed".

enforceSSL.description:
Enforces SSL for requests.

S3.5 of the AWS Foundational Security Best Practices Regarding S3.

eventBridgeEnabled.description: Whether this bucket should send notifications to Amazon EventBridge or not.

inventories.description: The inventory configuration of the bucket.

lifecycleRules.description: Rules that define how Amazon S3 manages objects during their lifetime.

metrics.description: The metrics configuration of this bucket.

notificationsHandlerRole.description: The role to be used by the notifications handler.

publicReadAccess.description:
Grants public read access to all objects in the bucket.

Similar to calling `bucket.grantPublicAccess()`

removalPolicy.description: Policy to apply when the bucket is removed from this stack.

serverAccessLogsBucket.description: Destination bucket for the server access logs.

serverAccessLogsPrefix.description:
Optional log file prefix to use for the bucket's access logs.

If defined without "serverAccessLogsBucket", enables access logs to current bucket with this prefix.

transferAcceleration.description: Whether this bucket should have transfer acceleration turned on or not.

versioned.description: Whether this bucket should have versioning turned on or not.

websiteErrorDocument.description: The name of the error document (e.g. "404.html") for the website. `websiteIndexDocument` must also be set if this is set.

websiteIndexDocument.description: The name of the index document (e.g. "index.html") for the website. Enables static website hosting for this bucket.

websiteRedirect.description:
Specifies the redirect behavior of all requests to a website endpoint of a bucket.

If you specify this property, you can't specify "websiteIndexDocument", "websiteErrorDocument" nor , "websiteRoutingRules".

websiteRoutingRules.description: Rules that define when a redirect is applied and the redirect behavior.

bucket.description: The Amazon S3 bucket that the policy applies to.

removalPolicy.description: Policy to apply when the policy is removed from this stack.

assetHash.description:
Specify a custom hash for this asset.

If `assetHashType` is set it must
be set to `AssetHashType.CUSTOM`. For consistency, this custom hash will
be SHA256 hashed and encoded as hex. The resulting hash will be the asset
hash.

NOTE: the hash is used in order to identify a specific revision of the asset, and
used for optimizing and caching deployment activities related to this asset such as
packaging, uploading to Amazon S3, etc. If you chose to customize the hash, you will
need to make sure it is updated every time the asset changes, or otherwise it is
possible that some deployments will not be invalidated.

assetHashType.description:
Specifies the type of hash to calculate for this asset.

If `assetHash` is configured, this option must be `undefined` or
`AssetHashType.CUSTOM`.

bundling.description:
Bundle the asset by executing a command in a Docker container or a custom bundling provider.

The asset path will be mounted at `/asset-input`. The Docker
container is responsible for putting content at `/asset-output`.
The content at `/asset-output` will be zipped and used as the
final asset.

exclude.description:
File paths matching the patterns will be excluded.

See `ignoreMode` to set the matching behavior.
Has no effect on Assets bundled using the `bundling` property.

followSymlinks.description: A strategy for how to handle symlinks.

ignoreMode.description: The ignore behavior to use for `exclude` patterns.

readers.description:
A list of principals that should be able to read this asset from S3.

You can use `asset.grantRead(principal)` to grant read permissions later.

path.description:
The disk location of the asset.

The path should refer to one of the following:
- A regular file or a .zip file, in which case the file will be uploaded as-is to S3.
- A directory, in which case it will be archived into a .zip file and uploaded to S3.

secret.description: The secret to attach a resource-based permissions policy.

excludeCharacters.description: A string of the characters that you don't want in the password.

functionName.description: A name for the Lambda created to rotate the secret.

securityGroups.description: A list of security groups for the Lambda created to rotate the secret.

vpc.description: The VPC where the Lambda rotation function will run.

vpcSubnets.description: The type of subnets in the VPC where the Lambda rotation function will run.

masterSecret.description: The master secret for a multi user rotation scheme.

excludeCharacters.description: A string of the characters that you don't want in the password.

functionName.description: A name for the Lambda created to rotate the secret.

securityGroups.description: A list of security groups for the Lambda created to rotate the secret.

vpc.description: The VPC where the Lambda rotation function will run.

vpcSubnets.description: The type of subnets in the VPC where the Lambda rotation function will run.

automaticallyAfter.description:
Specifies the number of days after the previous rotation before Secrets Manager triggers the next automatic rotation.

A value of zero will disable automatic rotation - `Duration.days(0)`.

rotationLambda.description: A Lambda function that can rotate the secret.

secret.description:
The secret to rotate.

If hosted rotation is used, this must be a JSON string with the following format:

```
{
   "engine": <required: database engine>,
   "host": <required: instance host name>,
   "username": <required: username>,
   "password": <required: password>,
   "dbname": <optional: database name>,
   "port": <optional: if not specified, default port will be used>,
   "masterarn": <required for multi user rotation: the arn of the master secret which will be used to create users/change passwords>
}
```

This is typically the case for a secret referenced from an `AWS::SecretsManager::SecretTargetAttachment`
or an `ISecret` returned by the `attach()` method of `Secret`.

excludeCharacters.description:
A string that includes characters that shouldn't be included in the generated password.

The string can be a minimum
of ``0`` and a maximum of ``4096`` characters long.

excludeLowercase.description: Specifies that the generated password shouldn't include lowercase letters.

excludeNumbers.description: Specifies that the generated password shouldn't include digits.

excludePunctuation.description: Specifies that the generated password shouldn't include punctuation characters.

excludeUppercase.description: Specifies that the generated password shouldn't include uppercase letters.

generateStringKey.description:
The JSON key name that's used to add the generated password to the JSON structure specified by the ``secretStringTemplate`` parameter.

If you specify ``generateStringKey`` then ``secretStringTemplate``
must be also be specified.

includeSpace.description: Specifies that the generated password can include the space character.

passwordLength.description: The desired length of the generated password.

requireEachIncludedType.description: Specifies whether the generated password must include at least one of every allowed character type.

secretStringTemplate.description:
A properly structured JSON string that the generated password can be added to.

The ``generateStringKey`` is
combined with the generated random string and inserted into the JSON structure that's specified by this parameter.
The merged JSON string is returned as the completed SecretString of the secret. If you specify ``secretStringTemplate``
then ``generateStringKey`` must be also be specified.

description.description: An optional, human-friendly description of the secret.

encryptionKey.description: The customer-managed encryption key to use for encrypting the secret value.

generateSecretString.description:
Configuration for how to generate a secret value.

Only one of `secretString` and `generateSecretString` can be provided.

removalPolicy.description: Policy to apply when the secret is removed from this stack.

replicaRegions.description: A list of regions where to replicate this secret.

secretName.description:
A name for the secret.

Note that deleting secrets from SecretsManager does not happen immediately, but after a 7 to
30 days blackout period. During that period, it is not possible to create another secret that shares the same name.

secretObjectValue.description:
Initial value for a JSON secret.

**NOTE:** *It is **highly** encouraged to leave this field undefined and allow SecretsManager to create the secret value.
The secret object -- if provided -- will be included in the output of the cdk as part of synthesis,
and will appear in the CloudFormation template in the console. This can be secure(-ish) if that value is merely reference to
another resource (or one of its attributes), but if the value is a plaintext string, it will be visible to anyone with access
to the CloudFormation template (via the AWS Console, SDKs, or CLI).

Specifies a JSON object that you want to encrypt and store in this new version of the secret.
To specify a simple string value instead, use {@link SecretProps.secretStringValue}

Only one of `secretStringBeta1`, `secretStringValue`, 'secretObjectValue', and `generateSecretString` can be provided.

secretStringBeta1.description:
Initial value for the secret.

**NOTE:** *It is **highly** encouraged to leave this field undefined and allow SecretsManager to create the secret value.
The secret string -- if provided -- will be included in the output of the cdk as part of synthesis,
and will appear in the CloudFormation template in the console. This can be secure(-ish) if that value is merely reference to
another resource (or one of its attributes), but if the value is a plaintext string, it will be visible to anyone with access
to the CloudFormation template (via the AWS Console, SDKs, or CLI).

Specifies text data that you want to encrypt and store in this new version of the secret.
May be a simple string value, or a string representation of a JSON structure.

Only one of `secretStringBeta1`, `secretStringValue`, and `generateSecretString` can be provided.

secretStringValue.description:
Initial value for the secret.

**NOTE:** *It is **highly** encouraged to leave this field undefined and allow SecretsManager to create the secret value.
The secret string -- if provided -- will be included in the output of the cdk as part of synthesis,
and will appear in the CloudFormation template in the console. This can be secure(-ish) if that value is merely reference to
another resource (or one of its attributes), but if the value is a plaintext string, it will be visible to anyone with access
to the CloudFormation template (via the AWS Console, SDKs, or CLI).

Specifies text data that you want to encrypt and store in this new version of the secret.
May be a simple string value. To provide a string representation of JSON structure, use {@link SecretProps.secretObjectValue} instead.

Only one of `secretStringBeta1`, `secretStringValue`, 'secretObjectValue', and `generateSecretString` can be provided.

application.description: The serverless application for the rotation.

secret.description:
The secret to rotate. It must be a JSON string with the following format:.

```
{
   "engine": <required: database engine>,
   "host": <required: instance host name>,
   "username": <required: username>,
   "password": <required: password>,
   "dbname": <optional: database name>,
   "port": <optional: if not specified, default port will be used>,
   "masterarn": <required for multi user rotation: the arn of the master secret which will be used to create users/change passwords>
}
```

This is typically the case for a secret referenced from an `AWS::SecretsManager::SecretTargetAttachment`
or an `ISecret` returned by the `attach()` method of `Secret`.

vpc.description: The VPC where the Lambda rotation function will run.

automaticallyAfter.description: Specifies the number of days after the previous rotation before Secrets Manager triggers the next automatic rotation.

endpoint.description:
The VPC interface endpoint to use for the Secrets Manager API.

If you enable private DNS hostnames for your VPC private endpoint (the default), you don't
need to specify an endpoint. The standard Secrets Manager DNS hostname the Secrets Manager
CLI and SDKs use by default (https://secretsmanager.<region>.amazonaws.com) automatically
resolves to your VPC endpoint.

excludeCharacters.description: Characters which should not appear in the generated password.

masterSecret.description: The master secret for a multi user rotation scheme.

securityGroup.description: The security group for the Lambda rotation function.

vpcSubnets.description: The type of subnets in the VPC where the Lambda rotation function will run.

target.description: The target to attach the secret to.

secret.description: The secret to attach to the target.

replaceProductVersionIds.description: Whether to give provisioning artifacts a new unique identifier when the product attributes or provisioning artifacts is updated.

currentVersionName.description: The current version name of the ProductStack.

productStack.description: The ProductStack whose history will be retained as a snapshot.

directory.description: The directory where template snapshots will be stored.

The keys of the map represent the tag keys,
and the values of the map are a list of allowed values for that particular tag key.

instanceCname.description: If the service configuration includes a CNAME record, the domain name that you want Route 53 to return in response to DNS queries, for example, example.com. This value is required if the service specified by ServiceId includes settings for an CNAME record.

ipv6.description: If the service that you specify contains a template for an AAAA record, the IPv6 address that you want AWS Cloud Map to use for the value of the AAAA record.

port.description:
The port on the endpoint that you want AWS Cloud Map to perform health checks on.

This value is also used for
the port value in an SRV record if the service that you specify includes an SRV record. You can also specify a
default port that is applied to all instances in the Service configuration.

service.description: The Cloudmap service this resource is registered to.

instanceId.description: The id of the instance resource.

failureThreshold.description: The number of 30-second intervals that you want Cloud Map to wait after receiving an UpdateInstanceCustomHealthStatus request before it changes the health status of a service instance.
The number of consecutive health checks that an endpoint must pass or fail for Route 53 to change the current status of the endpoint from unhealthy to healthy or vice versa.

resourcePath.description:
The path that you want Route 53 to request when performing health checks.

Do not use when health check type is TCP.

type.description:
The type of health check that you want to create, which indicates how Route 53 determines whether an endpoint is healthy.

Cannot be modified once created. Supported values are HTTP, HTTPS, and TCP.

customHealthCheck.description:
Structure containing failure threshold for a custom health checker.

Only one of healthCheckConfig or healthCheckCustomConfig can be specified.
See: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cloud-map/latest/api/API_HealthCheckCustomConfig.html

description.description: A description of the service.

healthCheck.description:
Settings for an optional health check.

If you specify health check settings, AWS Cloud Map associates the health
check with the records that you specify in DnsConfig. Only one of healthCheckConfig or healthCheckCustomConfig can
be specified. Not valid for PrivateDnsNamespaces. If you use healthCheck, you can only register IP instances to
this service.

discoveryType.description: Controls how instances within this service can be discovered.

dnsRecordType.description:
The DNS type of the record that you want AWS Cloud Map to create.

Supported record types
include A, AAAA, A and AAAA (A_AAAA), CNAME, and SRV.

dnsTtl.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that you want DNS resolvers to cache the settings for this record.

loadBalancer.description:
Whether or not this service will have an Elastic LoadBalancer registered to it as an AliasTargetInstance.

Setting this to `true` correctly configures the `routingPolicy`
and performs some additional validation.

routingPolicy.description: The routing policy that you want to apply to all DNS records that AWS Cloud Map creates when you register an instance and specify this service.

namespace.description: The namespace that you want to use for DNS configuration.

ips.description: A list of ip addresses or ranges to allow list.

configurationSetName.description: A name for the configuration set.

customTrackingRedirectDomain.description: The custom subdomain that is used to redirect email recipients to the Amazon SES event tracking domain.

dedicatedIpPool.description: The dedicated IP pool to associate with the configuration set.

reputationMetrics.description: Whether to publish reputation metrics for the configuration set, such as bounce and complaint rates, to Amazon CloudWatch.

suppressionReasons.description: The reasons for which recipient email addresses should be automatically added to your account's suppression list.

tlsPolicy.description: Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security (TLS).

dedicatedIpPoolName.description: A name for the dedicated IP pool.

name.description:
The name of the header to add.

Must be between 1 and 50 characters,
inclusive, and consist of alphanumeric (a-z, A-Z, 0-9) characters
and dashes only.

value.description:
The value of the header to add.

Must be less than 2048 characters,
and must not contain newline characters ("\r" or "\n").

sender.description:
The email address of the sender of the bounced email.

This is the address
from which the bounce message will be sent.

template.description: The template containing the message, reply code and status code.

topic.description: The SNS topic to notify when the bounce action is taken.

invocationType.description: The invocation type of the Lambda function.

topic.description: The SNS topic to notify when the Lambda action is taken.

bucket.description: The S3 bucket that incoming email will be saved to.

kmsKey.description: The master key that SES should use to encrypt your emails before saving them to the S3 bucket.

objectKeyPrefix.description: The key prefix of the S3 bucket.

topic.description: The SNS topic to notify when the S3 action is taken.

encoding.description: The encoding to use for the email within the Amazon SNS notification.

topic.description: The SNS topic to notify when the stop action is taken.

actions.description: An ordered list of actions to perform on messages that match at least one of the recipient email addresses or domains specified in the receipt rule.

after.description: An existing rule after which the new rule will be placed.

enabled.description: Whether the rule is active.

recipients.description: The recipient domains and email addresses that the receipt rule applies to.

scanEnabled.description: Whether to scan for spam and viruses.

tlsPolicy.description: Whether Amazon SES should require that incoming email is delivered over a connection encrypted with Transport Layer Security (TLS).

ruleSet.description: The name of the rule set that the receipt rule will be added to.

privateKey.description: The private key that's used to generate a DKIM signature.

selector.description: A string that's used to identify a public key in the DNS configuration for a domain.

publicKey.description:
The public key.

If specified, a TXT record with the public key is created.

identity.description: The email address or domain to verify.

configurationSet.description: The configuration set to associate with the email identity.

dkimIdentity.description: The type of DKIM identity to use.

dkimSigning.description: Whether the messages that are sent from the identity are signed using DKIM.

feedbackForwarding.description:
Whether to receive email notifications when bounce or complaint events occur.

These notifications are sent to the address that you specified in the `Return-Path`
header of the original email.

You're required to have a method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set
up another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications (for example, by
setting up an event destination), you receive an email notification when these events
occur (even if this setting is disabled).

mailFromBehaviorOnMxFailure.description: The action to take if the required MX record for the MAIL FROM domain isn't found when you send an email.

mailFromDomain.description:
The custom MAIL FROM domain that you want the verified identity to use.

The MAIL FROM domain
must meet the following criteria:
   - It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity
   - It can't be used to receive email
   - It can't be used in a "From" address if the MAIL FROM domain is a destination for feedback
     forwarding emails

ip.description: The ip address or range to filter.

receiptFilterName.description: The name for the receipt filter.

actions.description: An ordered list of actions to perform on messages that match at least one of the recipient email addresses or domains specified in the receipt rule.

after.description: An existing rule after which the new rule will be placed.

enabled.description: Whether the rule is active.

recipients.description: The recipient domains and email addresses that the receipt rule applies to.

scanEnabled.description: Whether to scan for spam and viruses.

The list of rules to add to this rule set.

Rules are added in the same
order as they appear in the list.

platform.description: The Signing Platform available for signing profile.

signatureValidity.description: The validity period for signatures generated using this signing profile.

signingProfileName.description: Physical name of this Signing Profile.

endpoint.description:
The subscription endpoint.

The meaning of this value depends on the value for 'protocol'.

protocol.description: What type of subscription to add.

deadLetterQueue.description:
Queue to be used as dead letter queue.

If not passed no dead letter queue is enabled.

rawMessageDelivery.description:
true if raw message delivery is enabled for the subscription.

Raw messages are free of JSON formatting and can be
sent to HTTP/S and Amazon SQS endpoints. For more information, see GetSubscriptionAttributes in the Amazon Simple
Notification Service API Reference.

region.description: The region where the topic resides, in the case of cross-region subscriptions.

subscriptionRoleArn.description:
Arn of role allowing access to firehose delivery stream.

Required for a firehose subscription protocol.

topics.description: The set of topics this policy applies to.

policyDocument.description: IAM policy document to apply to topic(s).

maxReceiveCount.description: The number of times a message can be unsuccesfully dequeued before being moved to the dead-letter queue.

queue.description: The dead-letter queue to which Amazon SQS moves messages after the value of maxReceiveCount is exceeded.

contentBasedDeduplication.description:
Specifies whether to enable content-based deduplication.

During the deduplication interval (5 minutes), Amazon SQS treats
messages that are sent with identical content (excluding attributes) as
duplicates and delivers only one copy of the message.

If you don't enable content-based deduplication and you want to deduplicate
messages, provide an explicit deduplication ID in your SendMessage() call.

(Only applies to FIFO queues.)

dataKeyReuse.description:
The length of time that Amazon SQS reuses a data key before calling KMS again.

The value must be an integer between 60 (1 minute) and 86,400 (24
hours). The default is 300 (5 minutes).

deadLetterQueue.description: Send messages to this queue if they were unsuccessfully dequeued a number of times.

deduplicationScope.description:
For high throughput for FIFO queues, specifies whether message deduplication occurs at the message group or queue level.

(Only applies to FIFO queues.)

deliveryDelay.description:
The time in seconds that the delivery of all messages in the queue is delayed.

You can specify an integer value of 0 to 900 (15 minutes). The default
value is 0.

encryption.description:
Whether the contents of the queue are encrypted, and by what type of key.

Be aware that encryption is not available in all regions, please see the docs
for current availability details.

encryptionMasterKey.description:
External KMS master key to use for queue encryption.

Individual messages will be encrypted using data keys. The data keys in
turn will be encrypted using this key, and reused for a maximum of
`dataKeyReuseSecs` seconds.

If the 'encryptionMasterKey' property is set, 'encryption' type will be
implicitly set to "KMS".

fifoThroughputLimit.description:
For high throughput for FIFO queues, specifies whether the FIFO queue throughput quota applies to the entire queue or per message group.

(Only applies to FIFO queues.)

maxMessageSizeBytes.description:
The limit of how many bytes that a message can contain before Amazon SQS rejects it.

You can specify an integer value from 1024 bytes (1 KiB) to 262144 bytes
(256 KiB). The default value is 262144 (256 KiB).

queueName.description:
A name for the queue.

If specified and this is a FIFO queue, must end in the string '.fifo'.

receiveMessageWaitTime.description:
Default wait time for ReceiveMessage calls.

Does not wait if set to 0, otherwise waits this amount of seconds
by default for messages to arrive.

For more information, see Amazon SQS Long Poll.

removalPolicy.description:
Policy to apply when the queue is removed from the stack.

Even though queues are technically stateful, their contents are transient and it
is common to add and remove Queues while rearchitecting your application. The
default is therefore `DESTROY`. Change it to `RETAIN` if the messages are so
valuable that accidentally losing them would be unacceptable.

retentionPeriod.description:
The number of seconds that Amazon SQS retains a message.

You can specify an integer value from 60 seconds (1 minute) to 1209600
seconds (14 days). The default value is 345600 seconds (4 days).

visibilityTimeout.description:
Timeout of processing a single message.

After dequeuing, the processor has this much time to handle the message
and delete it from the queue before it becomes visible again for dequeueing
by another processor.

Values must be from 0 to 43200 seconds (12 hours). If you don't specify
a value, AWS CloudFormation uses the default value of 30 seconds.

queues.description: The set of queues this policy applies to.

For example, for String types with values restricted to
numbers, you can specify the following: ``^\d+$``

simpleName.description:
Indicates of the parameter name is a simple name (i.e. does not include "/" separators).

This is only required only if `parameterName` is a token, which means we
are unable to detect if the name is simple or "path-like" for the purpose
of rendering SSM parameter ARNs.

If `parameterName` is not specified, `simpleName` must be `true` (or
undefined) since the name generated by AWS CloudFormation is always a
simple name.

jobDefinitionArn.description: The arn of the job definition used by this job.

jobName.description:
The name of the job.

The first character must be alphanumeric, and up to 128 letters (uppercase and lowercase),
numbers, hyphens, and underscores are allowed.

jobQueueArn.description: The arn of the job queue into which the job is submitted.

arraySize.description:
The array size can be between 2 and 10,000.

If you specify array properties for a job, it becomes an array job.
For more information, see Array Jobs in the AWS Batch User Guide.

attempts.description:
The number of times to move a job to the RUNNABLE status.

You may specify between 1 and 10 attempts.
If the value of attempts is greater than one,
the job is retried on failure the same number of attempts as the value.

containerOverrides.description: A list of container overrides in JSON format that specify the name of a container in the specified job definition and the overrides it should receive.

dependsOn.description:
A list of dependencies for the job.

A job can depend upon a maximum of 20 jobs.

payload.description: The payload to be passed as parameters to the batch job.

If set to SIZE, the response includes statistics about item collections, if any,
that were modified during the operation are returned in the response.
If set to NONE (the default), no statistics are returned.

The entry point of job application.

entryPointArguments.description:
The arguments for a job application in a task input object containing an array of strings.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 10280.

sparkSubmitParameters.description:
The Spark submit parameters that are used for job runs.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 102400.

sparkSubmitJobDriver.description: The job driver parameters specified for spark submit.

classification.description:
The classification within a configuration.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 1024.

properties.description:
A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.

Map Entries: Maximum number of 100 items.

logBucket.description:
Amazon S3 Bucket for monitoring log publishing.

You can configure your jobs to send log information to Amazon S3.

logging.description:
Enable logging for this job.

If set to true, will automatically create a Cloudwatch Log Group and S3 bucket.
This will be set to `true` implicitly if values are provided for `logGroup` or `logBucket`.

logGroup.description:
A log group for CloudWatch monitoring.

You can configure your jobs to send log information to CloudWatch Logs.

logStreamNamePrefix.description: A log stream name prefix for Cloudwatch monitoring.

persistentAppUI.description: Monitoring configurations for the persistent application UI.

jobDriver.description: The job driver for the job run.

releaseLabel.description: The Amazon EMR release version to use for the job run.

virtualCluster.description: The ID of the virtual cluster where the job will be run.

applicationConfig.description:
The configurations for the application running in the job run.

Maximum of 100 items

executionRole.description:
The execution role for the job run.

If `virtualClusterId` is from a JSON input path, an execution role must be provided.
If an execution role is provided, follow the documentation to update the role trust policy.

jobName.description: The name of the job run.

monitoring.description: Configuration for monitoring the job run.

tags.description: The tags assigned to job runs.

properties.description: A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.

volumeSize.description:
The volume size.

If the volume type is EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10GiB.
Maximum size is 1TiB

volumeType.description:
The volume type.

Volume types supported are gp2, io1, standard.

iops.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports.

volumeSpecification.description: EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size (GiB) that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance in the cluster.

volumesPerInstance.description: Number of EBS volumes with a specific volume configuration that will be associated with every instance in the instance group.

ebsBlockDeviceConfigs.description: An array of Amazon EBS volume specifications attached to a cluster instance.

ebsOptimized.description: Indicates whether an Amazon EBS volume is EBS-optimized.

bidPrice.description:
The bid price for each EC2 Spot instance type as defined by InstanceType.

Expressed in USD.

bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice.description: The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price.

configurations.description: A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster instances, which can include configurations for applications and software that run on the cluster.

ebsConfiguration.description: The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Storage (EBS) attached to each instance as defined by InstanceType.

weightedCapacity.description: The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in the InstanceFleetConfig.

timeoutAction.description: The action to take when TargetSpotCapacity has not been fulfilled when the TimeoutDurationMinutes has expired.

timeoutDurationMinutes.description: The spot provisioning timeout period in minutes.

allocationStrategy.description: Specifies the strategy to use in launching Spot Instance fleets.

blockDurationMinutes.description: The defined duration for Spot instances (also known as Spot blocks) in minutes.

spotSpecification.description: The launch specification for Spot instances in the fleet, which determines the defined duration and provisioning timeout behavior.

instanceFleetType.description:
The node type that the instance fleet hosts.

Valid values are MASTER,CORE,and TASK.

instanceTypeConfigs.description: The instance type configurations that define the EC2 instances in the instance fleet.

launchSpecifications.description: The launch specification for the instance fleet.

name.description: The friendly name of the instance fleet.

targetOnDemandCapacity.description: The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which determines how many On-Demand instances to provision.

targetSpotCapacity.description: The target capacity of Spot units for the instance fleet, which determines how many Spot instances to provision.

maxCapacity.description:
The upper boundary of EC2 instances in an instance group beyond which scaling activities are not allowed to grow.

Scale-out
activities will not add instances beyond this boundary.

minCapacity.description:
The lower boundary of EC2 instances in an instance group below which scaling activities are not allowed to shrink.

Scale-in
activities will not terminate instances below this boundary.

scalingAdjustment.description:
The amount by which to scale in or scale out, based on the specified AdjustmentType.

A positive value adds to the instance group's
EC2 instance count while a negative number removes instances. If AdjustmentType is set to EXACT_CAPACITY, the number should only be
a positive integer.

adjustmentType.description: The way in which EC2 instances are added (if ScalingAdjustment is a positive number) or terminated (if ScalingAdjustment is a negative number) each time the scaling activity is triggered.

coolDown.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before any further trigger-related scaling activities can start.

simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration.description: The type of adjustment the automatic scaling activity makes when triggered, and the periodicity of the adjustment.

market.description:
Not available for instance groups.

Instance groups use the market type specified for the group.

comparisonOperator.description: Determines how the metric specified by MetricName is compared to the value specified by Threshold.

metricName.description: The name of the CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an alarm condition.

period.description:
The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.

EMR CloudWatch metrics are emitted every five minutes (300 seconds), so if
an EMR CloudWatch metric is specified, specify 300.

evaluationPeriods.description: The number of periods, in five-minute increments, during which the alarm condition must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling activity.

namespace.description: The namespace for the CloudWatch metric.

statistic.description: The statistic to apply to the metric associated with the alarm.

threshold.description: The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

unit.description:
The unit of measure associated with the CloudWatch metric being watched.

The value specified for Unit must correspond to the units
specified in the CloudWatch metric.

cloudWatchAlarmDefinition.description:
The definition of a CloudWatch metric alarm.

When the defined alarm conditions are met along with other trigger parameters,
scaling activity begins.

action.description: The conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.

name.description:
The name used to identify an automatic scaling rule.

Rule names must be unique within a scaling policy.

trigger.description: The CloudWatch alarm definition that determines when automatic scaling activity is triggered.

description.description: A friendly, more verbose description of the automatic scaling rule.

constraints.description:
The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling policy.

Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance
group to grow above or below these limits.

rules.description: The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling policy.

instanceCount.description: Target number of instances for the instance group.

instanceRole.description: The role of the instance group in the cluster.

instanceType.description: The EC2 instance type for all instances in the instance group.

autoScalingPolicy.description: An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance group in an Amazon EMR cluster.

bidPrice.description:
The bid price for each EC2 Spot instance type as defined by InstanceType.

Expressed in USD.

configurations.description: The list of configurations supplied for an EMR cluster instance group.

ebsConfiguration.description: EBS configurations that will be attached to each EC2 instance in the instance group.

market.description: Market type of the EC2 instances used to create a cluster node.

name.description: Friendly name given to the instance group.

availabilityZone.description:
The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the cluster.

AvailabilityZone is used for uniform instance groups, while AvailabilityZones
(plural) is used for instance fleets.

availabilityZones.description:
When multiple Availability Zones are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and launches instances in the optimal Availability Zone.

AvailabilityZones is used for instance fleets, while AvailabilityZone (singular) is used for uniform instance groups.

additionalMasterSecurityGroups.description: A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master node.

additionalSlaveSecurityGroups.description: A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and task nodes.

ec2KeyName.description: The name of the EC2 key pair that can be used to ssh to the master node as the user called "hadoop.".

ec2SubnetId.description:
Applies to clusters that use the uniform instance group configuration.

To launch the cluster in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC),
set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the cluster to launch.

ec2SubnetIds.description:
Applies to clusters that use the instance fleet configuration.

When multiple EC2 subnet IDs are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and
launches instances in the optimal subnet.

emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.

emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task nodes.

hadoopVersion.description: Applies only to Amazon EMR release versions earlier than 4.0. The Hadoop version for the cluster.

instanceCount.description: The number of EC2 instances in the cluster.

instanceFleets.description:
Describes the EC2 instances and instance configurations for clusters that use the instance fleet configuration.

The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.

instanceGroups.description: Configuration for the instance groups in a cluster.

masterInstanceType.description: The EC2 instance type of the master node.

placement.description: The Availability Zone in which the cluster runs.

serviceAccessSecurityGroup.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.

slaveInstanceType.description: The EC2 instance type of the core and task nodes.

terminationProtected.description: Specifies whether to lock the cluster to prevent the Amazon EC2 instances from being terminated by API call, user intervention, or in the event of a job-flow error.

additionalInfo.description:
This option is for advanced users only.

This is meta information about third-party applications that third-party vendors use
for testing purposes.

args.description: Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the application.

path.description:
Location of the script to run during a bootstrap action.

Can be either a location in Amazon S3 or on a local file system.

args.description: A list of command line arguments to pass to the bootstrap action script.

name.description: The name of the bootstrap action.

scriptBootstrapAction.description: The script run by the bootstrap action.

realm.description:
The name of the Kerberos realm to which all nodes in a cluster belong.

For example, EC2.INTERNAL.

adDomainJoinPassword.description: The Active Directory password for ADDomainJoinUser.

adDomainJoinUser.description:
Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with an Active Directory domain.

A user with sufficient privileges to join
resources to the domain.

crossRealmTrustPrincipalPassword.description:
Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with a KDC in a different realm.

The cross-realm principal password, which
must be identical across realms.

kdcAdminPassword.description: The password used within the cluster for the kadmin service on the cluster-dedicated KDC, which maintains Kerberos principals, password policies, and keytabs for the cluster.

instances.description: A specification of the number and type of Amazon EC2 instances.

additionalInfo.description: A JSON string for selecting additional features.

applications.description: A case-insensitive list of applications for Amazon EMR to install and configure when launching the cluster.

autoScalingRole.description: An IAM role for automatic scaling policies.

bootstrapActions.description: A list of bootstrap actions to run before Hadoop starts on the cluster nodes.

clusterRole.description:
Also called instance profile and EC2 role.

An IAM role for an EMR cluster. The EC2 instances of the cluster assume this role.

This attribute has been renamed from jobFlowRole to clusterRole to align with other ERM/StepFunction integration parameters.

configurations.description: The list of configurations supplied for the EMR cluster you are creating.

customAmiId.description: The ID of a custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI.

ebsRootVolumeSize.description: The size of the EBS root device volume of the Linux AMI that is used for each EC2 instance.

kerberosAttributes.description: Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is enabled using a security configuration.

logUri.description: The location in Amazon S3 to write the log files of the job flow.

releaseLabel.description: The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of open-source application packages installed on the cluster.

scaleDownBehavior.description: Specifies the way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.

securityConfiguration.description: The name of a security configuration to apply to the cluster.

serviceRole.description: The IAM role that will be assumed by the Amazon EMR service to access AWS resources on your behalf.

stepConcurrencyLevel.description:
Specifies the step concurrency level to allow multiple steps to run in parallel.

Requires EMR release label 5.28.0 or above.
Must be in range [1, 256].

tags.description: A list of tags to associate with a cluster and propagate to Amazon EC2 instances.

visibleToAllUsers.description: A value of true indicates that all IAM users in the AWS account can perform cluster actions if they have the proper IAM policy permissions.

targetOnDemandCapacity.description: The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet.

targetSpotCapacity.description: The target capacity of Spot units for the instance fleet.

instancesToProtect.description: Specific list of instances to be protected when shrinking an instance group.

instancesToTerminate.description: Specific list of instances to be terminated when shrinking an instance group.

instanceTerminationTimeout.description: Decommissioning timeout override for the specific list of instances to be terminated.

decommissionTimeout.description:
The desired timeout for decommissioning an instance.

Overrides the default YARN decommissioning timeout.

instanceResizePolicy.description: Custom policy for requesting termination protection or termination of specific instances when shrinking an instance group.

configurations.description: A list of new or modified configurations to apply for an instance group.

eC2InstanceIdsToTerminate.description:
The EC2 InstanceIds to terminate.

After you terminate the instances, the instance group will not return to its original requested size.

instanceCount.description: Target size for the instance group.

For this job run, they replace the default arguments set in the job
definition itself.

notifyDelayAfter.description:

Must be at least 1 minute.

securityConfiguration.description:
The name of the SecurityConfiguration structure to be used with this job run.

This must match the Glue API

clientContext.description: Up to 3583 bytes of base64-encoded data about the invoking client to pass to the function.

invocationType.description: Invocation type of the Lambda function.

payload.description: The JSON that will be supplied as input to the Lambda function.

payloadResponseOnly.description:
Invoke the Lambda in a way that only returns the payload response without additional metadata.

The `payloadResponseOnly` property cannot be used if `integrationPattern`, `invocationType`,
`clientContext`, or `qualifier` are specified.
It always uses the REQUEST_RESPONSE behavior.

qualifier.description:
Version or alias to invoke a published version of the function.

You only need to supply this if you want the version of the Lambda Function to depend
on data in the state machine state. If not, you can pass the appropriate Alias or Version object
directly as the `lambdaFunction` argument.

retryOnServiceExceptions.description:
Whether to retry on Lambda service exceptions.

This handles `Lambda.ServiceException`, `Lambda.AWSLambdaException` and
`Lambda.SdkClientException` with an interval of 2 seconds, a back-off rate
of 2 and 6 maximum attempts.

The name must be unique within an AWS Region in your AWS account.

tags.description: Tags to be applied to the endpoint.

modelName.description:
The name of the model that you want to host.

This is the name that you specified when creating the model.

variantName.description: The name of the production variant.

acceleratorType.description: The size of the Elastic Inference (EI) instance to use for the production variant.

initialInstanceCount.description: Number of instances to launch initially.

initialVariantWeight.description: Determines initial traffic distribution among all of the models that you specify in the endpoint configuration.

endpointConfigName.description: The name of the endpoint configuration.

productionVariants.description:
An list of ProductionVariant objects, one for each model that you want to host at this endpoint.

Identifies a model that you want to host and the resources to deploy for hosting it.
If you are deploying multiple models, tell Amazon SageMaker how to distribute traffic among the models by specifying variant weights.

kmsKey.description: AWS Key Management Service key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance that hosts the endpoint.

tags.description: Tags to be applied to the endpoint configuration.

containerHostName.description:
This parameter is ignored for models that contain only a PrimaryContainer.

When a ContainerDefinition is part of an inference pipeline,
the value of the parameter uniquely identifies the container for the purposes of logging and metrics.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables to set in the Docker container.

image.description: The Amazon EC2 Container Registry (Amazon ECR) path where inference code is stored.

mode.description: Defines how many models the container hosts.

modelPackageName.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model package to use to create the model.

modelS3Location.description:
The S3 path where the model artifacts, which result from model training, are stored.

This path must point to a single gzip compressed tar archive (.tar.gz suffix).
The S3 path is required for Amazon SageMaker built-in algorithms, but not if you use your own algorithms.

modelName.description: The name of the new model.

primaryContainer.description: The definition of the primary docker image containing inference code, associated artifacts, and custom environment map that the inference code uses when the model is deployed for predictions.

containers.description: Specifies the containers in the inference pipeline.

enableNetworkIsolation.description:
Isolates the model container.

No inbound or outbound network calls can be made to or from the model container.

role.description: An execution role that you can pass in a CreateModel API request.

subnetSelection.description: The subnets of the VPC to which the hosted model is connected (Note this parameter is only used when VPC is provided).

tags.description: Tags to be applied to the model.

vpc.description: The VPC that is accessible by the hosted model.

regex.description: Regular expression that searches the output of a training job and gets the value of the metric.

algorithmName.description:
Name of the algorithm resource to use for the training job.

This must be an algorithm resource that you created or subscribe to on AWS Marketplace.
If you specify a value for this parameter, you can't specify a value for TrainingImage.

metricDefinitions.description:
List of metric definition objects.

Each object specifies the metric name and regular expressions used to parse algorithm logs.

trainingImage.description: Registry path of the Docker image that contains the training algorithm.

trainingInputMode.description: Input mode that the algorithm supports.

attributeNames.description: List of one or more attribute names to use that are found in a specified augmented manifest file.

s3DataSource.description: S3 location of the data source that is associated with a channel.

compressionType.description: Compression type if training data is compressed.

contentType.description: The MIME type of the data.

inputMode.description: Input mode to use for the data channel in a training job.

recordWrapperType.description:
Specify RecordIO as the value when input data is in raw format but the training algorithm requires the RecordIO format.

In this case, Amazon SageMaker wraps each individual S3 object in a RecordIO record.
If the input data is already in RecordIO format, you don't need to set this attribute.

shuffleConfig.description: Shuffle config option for input data in a channel.

s3OutputLocation.description: Identifies the S3 path where you want Amazon SageMaker to store the model artifacts.

encryptionKey.description: Optional KMS encryption key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt the model artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption.

instanceCount.description: The number of ML compute instances to use.

instanceType.description:
ML compute instance type.

To provide an instance type from the task input, supply an instance type in the following way
where the value in the task input is an EC2 instance type prepended with "ml.":

```ts
new ec2.InstanceType(sfn.JsonPath.stringAt('$.path.to.instanceType'));
```

volumeSize.description: Size of the ML storage volume that you want to provision.

volumeEncryptionKey.description: KMS key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that run the training job.

maxRuntime.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that the training or compilation job can run.

vpc.description: VPC.

comment.description: An optional description for this state.

input to be the empty object {}.

algorithmSpecification.description: Identifies the training algorithm to use.

inputDataConfig.description: Describes the various datasets (e.g. train, validation, test) and the Amazon S3 location where stored.

outputDataConfig.description: Identifies the Amazon S3 location where you want Amazon SageMaker to save the results of model training.

enableNetworkIsolation.description:
Isolates the training container.

No inbound or outbound network calls can be made to or from the training container.

environment.description: Environment variables to set in the Docker container.

hyperparameters.description:
Algorithm-specific parameters that influence the quality of the model.

Set hyperparameters before you start the learning process.
For a list of hyperparameters provided by Amazon SageMaker

resourceConfig.description: Specifies the resources, ML compute instances, and ML storage volumes to deploy for model training.

role.description:
Role for the Training Job.

The role must be granted all necessary permissions for the SageMaker training job to
be able to operate.

See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/fr_fr/sagemaker/latest/dg/sagemaker-roles.html#sagemaker-roles-createtrainingjob-perms

stoppingCondition.description: Sets a time limit for training.

tags.description: Tags to be applied to the train job.

vpcConfig.description: Specifies the VPC that you want your training job to connect to.

s3Uri.description: Identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest.

s3DataSource.description: S3 location of the input data.

transformDataSource.description: S3 location of the channel data.

compressionType.description: The compression type of the transform data.

contentType.description: Multipurpose internet mail extension (MIME) type of the data.

splitType.description: Method to use to split the transform job's data files into smaller batches.

s3OutputPath.description: S3 path where you want Amazon SageMaker to store the results of the transform job.

accept.description: MIME type used to specify the output data.

assembleWith.description: Defines how to assemble the results of the transform job as a single S3 object.

encryptionKey.description: AWS KMS key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt the model artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption.

invocationsMaxRetries.description: The maximum number of retries when invocation requests are failing.

invocationsTimeout.description: The timeout duration for an invocation request.

instanceCount.description: Number of ML compute instances to use in the transform job.

instanceType.description: ML compute instance type for the transform job.

volumeEncryptionKey.description: AWS KMS key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s).

message.description:
The message you want to send.

With the exception of SMS, messages must be UTF-8 encoded strings and
at most 256 KB in size.
For SMS, each message can contain up to 140 characters.

topic.description: The SNS topic that the task will publish to.

messageAttributes.description:
Add message attributes when publishing.

These attributes carry additional metadata about the message and may be used
for subscription filters.

messagePerSubscriptionType.description:
Send different messages for each transport protocol.

For example, you might want to send a shorter message to SMS subscribers
and a more verbose message to email and SQS subscribers.

Your message must be a JSON object with a top-level JSON key of
"default" with a value that is a string
You can define other top-level keys that define the message you want to
send to a specific transport protocol (i.e. "sqs", "email", "http", etc)

subject.description:
Used as the "Subject" line when the message is delivered to email endpoints.

This field will also be included, if present, in the standard JSON messages
delivered to other endpoints.

queue.description: The SQS queue that messages will be sent to.

delay.description:
The length of time, for which to delay a message.

Messages that you send to the queue remain invisible to consumers for the duration
of the delay period. The maximum allowed delay is 15 minutes.

messageDeduplicationId.description:
The token used for deduplication of sent messages.

Any messages sent with the same deduplication ID are accepted successfully,
but aren't delivered during the 5-minute deduplication interval.

messageGroupId.description:
The tag that specifies that a message belongs to a specific message group.

Messages that belong to the same message group are processed in a FIFO manner.
Messages in different message groups might be processed out of order.

stateMachine.description: The Step Functions state machine to start the execution on.

associateWithParent.description:
Pass the execution ID from the context object to the execution input.

This allows the Step Functions UI to link child executions from parent executions, making it easier to trace execution flow across state machines.

If you set this property to `true`, the `input` property must be an object (provided by `sfn.TaskInput.fromObject`) or omitted entirely.

input.description: The JSON input for the execution, same as that of StartExecution.

name.description: The name of the execution, same as that of StartExecution.

endStates.description: The chainable end state(s) of this chainable.

startState.description: The start state of this chainable.

destination.description: The log group where the execution history events will be logged.

includeExecutionData.description: Determines whether execution data is included in your log.

level.description: Defines which category of execution history events are logged.

logs.description: Defines what execution history events are logged and where they are logged.

role.description: The execution role for the state machine service.

stateMachineName.description: A name for the state machine.

timeout.description: Maximum run time for this state machine.

tracingEnabled.description: Specifies whether Amazon X-Ray tracing is enabled for this state machine.

comment.description: An optional description for this state.

inputPath.description:
JSONPath expression to select part of the state to be the input to this state.

May also be the special value JsonPath.DISCARD, which will cause the effective
input to be the empty object {}.
